author: Cligra
title: Great freebie!
review:
Background

Rod “Torque” Redline, was given out at various Toys "R" Us stores as part of the Bricktober 2011 event. To get the car, you had to stand in line, and, once you neared the head of it, you were given a sheet of instructions and a sticker sheet. The instructions themselves were printed on nice paper, but the image quality was very blurry, although not enough to hinder the building (the stickers were not the best quality either). A parts inventory was printed on the directions, and you had to select all of the necessary parts out of labeled bins. Once you had done this, you walked over to a table were you could build your model (store official were on hand to help out the younger builders), and on the whole I found it a rather pleasant experience (especially since there were recent sets to drool over while you were in line....). But enough of that, onto the

Box/Instructions

The Instruction's images were terrible quality. 'Nuff said.

Parts

Quite nice really, although nothing really rare, unless you count the stickers (which were below the usual standard for LEGO).

The build

Nothing challenging here, just a standard car build.

The completed model

A very nice homage to the American muscle car, the only qualms I have about the model are the stickers, and the fact that the back (which is a single slanted piece) looks terrible, and breaks off easily)

Summary

Great model, and hey, it was free! (in fact, it is probably even worth buying online, especially if you are a Cars completest.) Pity it has stickers instead of printing, though.
